answerText: basalt[10] Basalt is fine-grained because it forms in this place, allowing it to cool quickly. This gives basalt its designation as "extrusive."
heading: ACF Regionals 2014 |2014 | Harvard-Florida A-Louisville A | 2 | Science | Other | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  [10] Name this common mafic and fine-grained extrusive igneous rock that is low in silica.
